title: Fake News: NO Mosquito Species Discovered That Can Get You Pregnant With A Single Bite | Lead Stories
subtitle: Is there a new mosquito species named "mosquito chirulí" that can get people pregnant with a single bite? No, that's...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Is there a new mosquito species named "mosquito chirulí" that can get people pregnant with a single bite? No, that's not true: the story originated from the English version of a Spanish satire website, it is not real.

The story appeared in an article published by There Is News on May 27, 2018 titled "New mosquito species discovered, can get you pregnant with a single bite" (archived here) which opened:

The Spanish government warn of three cases in Spain of people affected by the so-called "mosquito chirulí", able to make a woman pregnant with just a peck. The cases have been located in Cartagena, Cáceres and Lugo and those affected have been quarantined. The existence of this mosquito was known at the end of 2016 in Uganda and Kenya, but never before have there been cases outside these countries. It is a mosquito that has mutated and is able to inoculate you a species of sperm that through blood get fertilize the ovum in fertile women (there have never been cases in men). There is information that this mosquito has been responsible for more than 2,000 pregnancies in Africa.

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail:

The site There Is News carries a "Legal Warging" (archived here) that reads:

The site "There is news" (http://thereisnews.es) (hereinafter referred to as TIN) is a humor site whose purpose is entertainment. The content of TIN is fiction and does not correspond to reality. All references, names, brands or institutions that appear on the site are used as contextual elements, as in any novel or fiction account.

The site is the English language version of the Spanish satire site Hay Noticia, which is owned by Spanish humor website/collective La Fabrica de la Comedia S.C.

We wrote about thereisnews.com before, here are our most recent articles that mention the site:

• Fake News: Man Did NOT Skip Police Control Because He Thought They Were Filming 'Star Wars'
